s: I had collected over 20 sides by Art Blakey and the Jazz Messengers before recently noticing this 1956 release on Columbia. It's second to none--a recording that captures the then nascent Messengers at their zenith but also sets a standard approached by very few other quintets.

t: r/Jazz on Reddit: Art Blakey & Jazz Messengers
s: August 19, 2024 - I was really excited to get it ... - brand new, with the plastic wrapping. I get home and go to put it on but turns out there's another LP in the sleeve and it's not even Art Blakey, let alone Mosaic! I had to go in and show them but I got a new one with the correct vinyl in the sleeve haha. Never happened to me since and I hope it never happens again. ... Love all these albums…can’t get enough. ... Best Jazz Messengers ...

BLAKEY,ART & THE JAZZ MESSENGERS - Reflections In Blue - Amazon.com Music
s: Arthur (Art) Blakey (October 11, 1919-October 16, 1990), also known as Abdullah Ibn Buhaina, was an American jazz drummer and bandleader. Along with Kenny Clarke and Max Roach, he was one of the inventors of the modern bebop style of drumming. He is known as a powerful musician and a vital groover; his brand of bluesy, funky hard bop was (and remains) profoundly influential on mainstream jazz. Over more than 30 years his band the Jazz Messengers ...

t: The Jazz Messengers - Wikipedia
s: 1 week ago - The Jazz Messengers were a jazz combo that existed for over thirty-five years beginning in the early 1950s as a collective, and ending when long-time leader and founding drummer Art Blakey died in 1990. Blakey led or co-led the group from the outset.
